author: M Balaganessin
text:
The ancient ritual of sevai for Sri Sayana Perumal and Sri Sayana Thaayar has been revived at Sri Ranganathaswamy Temple at Srirangam late on Wednesday night after a gap of several centuries.— PHOTO: M. SRINATH

An ancient ritual which had been discontinued a few hundred years ago has been revived at Srirangam Sri Ranganathaswamy Temple.

The processional deities of Sri Sayana Perumal and Sri Sayana Thayar are kept at the sanctum sanctorum of Sri Ranganathar and Sri Ranganayaki respectively.

As per convention, the idol of Sri Sayana Perumal used to be taken to Sri Sayana Thayar sannidhi every night.

After preliminary poojai, the idol of Sri Sayana Perumal was kept along side the Sri Sayana Thayar.

The ritual remained suspended for the past several centuries but devotees have been making a plea for its revival, particularly after the ‘samprokshanam’ of the temple last year.

“Bowing to the wishes of the devotees and adhering to the ancient system established by the Acharyas, we have revived this system with effect from Wednesday night,” says P. Jayaraman, Joint Commissioner of Hindu Religious and Charitable Endowment Department also Executive Officer of the temple.

It takes about 45 minutes for performing the ritual. It will be performed at night before the closure of the sanctum sanctorum on all days except during special festivals such as ‘Vaikunta Ekadasi’. The ritual is similar to the ‘artha jama pujai’ performed at Saivite temples, he added.

The Viswaroopa Darshanam will be allowed only after Sri Sayana Perumal is brought from the sanctum sanctorum of Sri Thayar early in the morning.
title: ‘Sayana sevai’ revived at Srirangam temple
